msContents.summary: Fragment A bears the end of a letter which was probably sent by Claudius Terentianus to Claudius Tiberianus, as was P.Mich. VIII, 468; the other fragments come probably also from letters, as the other texts in the archive

msItemStruct.note: According to R. Marichal, these fragments show three different hands (ABC, DEF, GHI) and come from at least three different documents; however, the direction of the fibres show that frg. B belonged to a different text than frgg. AC, and frg. I from frgg. GH. The nine fragments would then be remains of five different documents. (PH);Three small fragments bear no writing.
Pub. status: Recto (fragments B, D, E, F, G, H) or Verso (fragments A, C, I); other side of each fragment is blank
Archive of Claudius Tiberianus; frg. A offers a text very similar to P.Mich. VIII, 468

supportDesc.support: 12 papyri ; Frg. A: 19.1 x 9.7 cm; ;Frg. B: 2.6 x 12 cm;;Frg. C: 4.2 x 2.7 cm;;Frg. D: 1.8 x 7.1 cm;;Frg. E: 1.8 x 5.4 cm;;Frg. F: 1.6 x 3.3 cm;;Frg. G: 7.7 x 3.6 cm;;Frg. H: 6.8 x 5 cm;;Frg. I: 4.8 x 3.7 cm

condition.ab: Frg. A broken off at the top and on the right side; frg. H complete on the left side, frg. I complete at the top; other fragments broken off on all sides. All much damaged.

layout.ab: Frg. A - 11;;Frg. B - 16;;Frg. C - 5;;Frg. D - 12;;Frg. E - 7;;Frg. F - 4;;Frg. G - 5;;Frg. H - 1;;Frg. I - 3

handDesc.p: Fragments A, B, C from the same hand; D, E, F from another; G, H, I from a third hand; all three hands are those of unskilled scribes (Marichal)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

listBibl.bibl: Rep Editor - Cugusi P.; Rep Ser. - C.Epist.Lat.; 1992; No. 143 (fragments A-C only) and 148 (fragments D-I). Rodgers RH, ZPE 5, 91-96, 1970, Pl. Ia Bruckner A-Marichal R, Ch.L.A. V, 299, 1976, Photo -- See notes
